place.name: MORTON BAGOT
place.gazetteerText: MORTON-BAGGOT, a parish in Alcester district, Warwick; at the boundary with Worcester, 3 miles WSW of Henley-in-Arden, and 5 NW of Bearley r. station. Post town, Stud ley, under Redditch. Acres, 1,180. Real property, £1,401. Pop., 1 39. Houses, 28. The property is divided among a few. The living is a rectory in the diocese of Worcester. Value, £160. Patron, Sir F. L. H. Goodricke, Bart. The church is a very plain building. (In 1870-72, John Marius Wilson's Imperial Gazetteer of England and Wales)
